intro: Vicia melanops, commonly known as the black vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a legume belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several elliptical seeds, which are often used as a food source for various animals. Vicia melanops thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed habitats. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
